meanings.definition: The process of making something uniform or similar throughout.
meanings.sent1: Homogenization of the milk ensures that it has the same fat content in every sip.
meanings.sent2: The homogenization of opinions led to a unanimous decision among the group.
meanings.sent3: The homogenization of colors in the painting made it look like a rainbow melted on the canvas.
meanings.sent4: In the world of music, the homogenization of genres creates new and unique sounds.
meanings.sent5: The homogenization of ingredients in the recipe guarantees a consistent taste every time.

meanings.definition: The act of blending different elements together to create a consistent mixture.
meanings.sent1: The homogenization of flavors in the soup made it delicious and well-balanced.
meanings.sent2: Homogenization of various cultures in the city resulted in a rich and diverse community.
meanings.sent3: The homogenization of scents in the room made it smell like a fragrant garden.
meanings.sent4: The homogenization of voices in the choir created a harmonious and beautiful melody.
meanings.sent5: Through the homogenization of ingredients, the baker achieved a perfect texture in the cake.
